recommendations.title: The Three Long Years When My Baby Hated Me
recommendations.excerpt: Precisely when we finished weaning, her parental preference shifted dramatically, and in favor of my husband.

recommendations.title: Generation Z Is Unprecedentedly Rich
recommendations.excerpt: Generation Z is taking over. In the rich world there are at least 250m people born between 1997 and 2012. About half are now in a job.

recommendations.title: Influencing Severus Snape to SRK, why Lord Byron still captures our imagination
recommendations.excerpt: “Mad, bad, and dangerous to know,” is how Lady Caroline Lamb described her lover Lord George Byron (1788-1824), an unlikely Romantic hero, who breathed life into a million literary characters — and continues to do so, two centuries after his passing.

recommendations.title: What Science Is Just Starting to Understand About Periods
recommendations.excerpt: Researchers are still only beginning to explore exactly how menstruation can affect health — and, in some people, worsen symptoms of illness.

recommendations.title: A Grammatical Annoyance: "I Resonate With That"
recommendations.excerpt: The first time I noticed it, I thought it was just a mistake: someone mixing up the grammar, not knowing it should read.

recommendations.title: India Needs to Invest in Education, Healthcare to Continue As Fastest-Growing Economy Globally, Says IMF Official
recommendations.excerpt: The International Monetary Fund in its latest World Economic Outlook edition said that India is estimated to grow at 6.8 per cent FY24 and maintain a growth rate of 6.5 per cent in FY25

recommendations.title: First Hollywood, and Now World Cinema Doing Well in India Speak of a Discerning and Receptive Audience
recommendations.excerpt: When Titanic was released in 1997, there was only one print in entire Delhi. There was a time, not so long ago, when only Hindi movies used to play at the single screen cinemas in India.

recommendations.title: Cricket, a Big Business in India, Brings Star Power to the U.S. With the Country’s First World Cup
recommendations.excerpt: A cricket world cup is arriving in the U.S. for the first time as the country explores its future with the sport.

recommendations.title: India’s Jobs Vs Education Conundrum Needs a Deeper Fix
recommendations.excerpt: This youthful workforce has the potential to drive economic growth, innovation, and productivity. However, the recent India Employment Report 2024, jointly published by the International Labour Organisation and the Institute of Human Development, paints an alarming picture.

recommendations.title: China’s API Extortion From Indian Pharma Breaking Down
recommendations.excerpt: The API coming from China started getting dumped in India at very low prices.

recommendations.title: Life lessons from the oldest people in the world
recommendations.excerpt: María Branyas Morera, aged 117, is the oldest person in the world. She was born in California on 4 March 1907 to Spanish parents who decided to return home in 1915.

recommendations.title: 12 Simple Questions You Should Ask Before Making Investing Decisions
recommendations.excerpt: How do you make the right investing decisions? It’s all about yourself asking the right questions and making hard simple.

recommendations.title: ‘Super Cute Please Like’: The Unstoppable Rise of Shein
recommendations.excerpt: It is taking fast fashion to ever faster and ever cheaper extremes, and making billions from it. Why is the whole world shopping at Shein?

recommendations.title: Alien Planets Might Teem With Purple — Yes, Purple — Life
recommendations.excerpt: NASA has already spotted a diversity of rocky, Earth-like worlds in the cosmos. But unlike our verdant planet, many of these worlds may flourish with purple life — if life exists out there, that is.

recommendations.title: Vinesh, Reetika, Anshu secure Paris Olympics quotas for India
recommendations.excerpt: Making a strong comeback to international arena after leading a prolonged protest against former WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, celebrated Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat locked Paris Olympics quota in women’s 50kg category with a strong show at the Asian Olympic Qualifier, in Bishkek on April

recommendations.title: Taylor Swift’s Trainer Reveals Her Eras Workout Routine—And His Identity
recommendations.excerpt: Do we really have the same amount of hours in the day as Taylor Swift? It's hard for me to imagine—she's writing entire surprise albums while on the highest-grossing tour in history for a different Grammy-winning album; I'm having trouble balancing finishing my laundry, finding time to eat lunch,

recommendations.title: Indian environment tech sector has raised a total funding of $7.3B to date
recommendations.excerpt: According to a report by data platform Tracxn, India's environmental technology funding saw substantial growth between 2018 and 2022, surging from $0.23 billion to $2.47 billion.

recommendations.title: Meet India’s Generation Z
recommendations.excerpt: India changes more in five years than many countries would in a quarter century. This is partly because it is still relatively young: The country gained independence just 76 years ago, and nearly half of its population is under the age of 25.

recommendations.title: How Narendra Modi Created a Cult of Personality
recommendations.excerpt: Experts say Indian PM is hoping to be ‘bigger than Gandhi’ as he aims to win a third term in office.

recommendations.title: Souk Stories: Explore the Best Flea Markets in India for a Shopaholic’s Delight
recommendations.excerpt: Skip the souvenir shops on your travels and explore the exciting world of India's best flea markets across Mumbai, Delhi, Goa and beyond.

recommendations.title: Are celebrity chefs sellouts?
recommendations.excerpt: David Chang’s public apology and the announcement that his company Momofuku would back off of an attempt to trademark the term “chili crunch” feel like standard damage control for a popular chef and the empire he’s built.

recommendations.title: Modi Govt Doubled Spending On Insurance, Not Enough On Health Infrastructure
recommendations.excerpt: The National Health Policy, 2002, had set a target of 2% of GDP by 2010; the United Progressive Alliance government, in 2004, had set a goal to increase public-health spending to 2-3% of GDP over a five-year period; and the Centre’s 12th five-year plan set the target at 1.

recommendations.title: This ancient snake in India might have been longer than a school bus and weighed a ton
recommendations.excerpt: A ancient giant snake in India might have been longer than a school bus and weighed a ton, researchers reported Thursday. Fossils found near a coal mine revealed a snake that stretched an estimated 36 feet (11 meters) to 50 feet (15 meters).

recommendations.title: India aims to achieve debris-free space missions by 2030
recommendations.excerpt: India has made a declaration to achieve debris-free space missions by 2030. Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Chairman S. Somanath made the declaration on April 16, at the 42nd Inter-Agency Space Debris Coordination Committee (IADC) annual meet.

recommendations.title: Where India’s Trade With Israel and Iran Stands, and Whether Regional Tensions Could Impact It
recommendations.excerpt: Iran’s attack on Israel earlier this week has sparked tensions in the Middle East and beyond. India, which has friendly ties with both the countries, has expressed “serious concerns” about escalation of hostilities. An escalation could also worry traders in the region and spook markets.

recommendations.title: It’s Time to Retire the Term “User”
recommendations.excerpt: The proliferation of AI means we need a new word.

recommendations.title: 12 Writers on Their Literary Experiences of Democracy
recommendations.excerpt: Every five years, as Indian democracy gears up for its biggest carnival—the general election—publishers fall in step with the spirit of the season. Suddenly bookshops are flush with political titles.

recommendations.title: Coffee's prehistoric origin is older than homo sapiens, finds study
recommendations.excerpt: You might call it a cup of Joe, java, mud, brew, mocha, or your morning jolt. Coffee undoubtedly is a big part of global culture, and the kind made from the Arabica bean is the most appreciated by coffee drinkers.

recommendations.title: Indian BrahMos missiles delivered to the Philippines: The missile’s significance
recommendations.excerpt: India’s BrahMos supersonic cruise missiles were delivered to the Philippines on Friday (April 19), as part of a $375 deal signed by the two countries in 2022

recommendations.title: How EVMs Came Into Being: a Brief History
recommendations.excerpt: Elections are the heartbeat of a democracy. When India became independent, sceptics thought a poor and illiterate nation would fail to keep democracy alive. Elections are the heartbeat of a democracy.
